com.thinkaurelius.titan.diskstorage.cassandra.thrift

Class CassandraThriftKeyColumnValueStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thinkaurelius.titan.diskstorage.cassandra.thrift.CassandraThriftKeyColumnValueStore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    KeyColumnValueStore

    public class CassandraThriftKeyColumnValueStore
extends Object
implements KeyColumnValueStore
    A Titan KeyColumnValueStore backed by Cassandra. This uses the Cassandra Thrift API.
    Author:
    Dan LaRocque
    See Also:
    CassandraThriftStoreManager

    • Method Detail

      • getSlice

        public List<Entry> getSlice(KeySliceQuery query,
                   StoreTransaction txh)
                     throws StorageException
        Call Cassandra's Thrift get_slice() method.

        When columnEnd equals columnStart, and both startInclusive and endInclusive are true, then this method calls get(java.nio.ByteBuffer, java.nio.ByteBuffer, com.thinkaurelius.titan.diskstorage.keycolumnvalue.StoreTransaction) instead of calling Thrift's getSlice() method and returns a one-element list containing the result.

        When columnEnd equals columnStart and either startInclusive or endInclusive is false (or both are false), then this method returns an empty list without making any Thrift calls.

        If columnEnd = columnStart + 1, and both startInclusive and startExclusive are false, then the arguments effectively form an empty interval. In this case, as in the one previous, an empty list is returned. However, it may not necessarily be handled efficiently; a Thrift call might still be made before returning the empty list.

        Specified by:
        getSlice in interface KeyColumnValueStore
        Parameters:
        query - Query to get results for
        txh - Transaction
        Returns:
        List of entries up to a maximum of "limit" entries
        Throws:
        StorageException - when columnEnd < columnStart
        See Also:
        KeySliceQuery

      • acquireLock

        public void acquireLock(ByteBuffer key,
               ByteBuffer column,
               ByteBuffer expectedValue,
               StoreTransaction txh)
                 throws StorageException
        Description copied from interface: KeyColumnValueStore
        Acquires a lock for the key-column pair which ensures that nobody else can take a lock on that respective entry for the duration of this lock (but somebody could potentially still overwrite the key-value entry without taking a lock). The expectedValue defines the value expected to match the value at the time the lock is acquired (or null if it is expected that the key-column pair does not exist).

        If this method is called multiple times with the same key-column pair in the same transaction, all but the first invocation are ignored.

        The lock has to be released when the transaction closes (commits or aborts).

        Specified by:
        acquireLock in interface KeyColumnValueStore
        Parameters:
        key - Key on which to lock
        column - Column the column on which to lock
        expectedValue - The expected value for the specified key-column pair on which to lock. Null if it is expected that the pair does not exist
        txh - Transaction
        Throws:
        StorageException

      • getKeys

        public RecordIterator<ByteBuffer> getKeys(StoreTransaction txh)
                                   throws StorageException
        Description copied from interface: KeyColumnValueStore
        Returns an iterator over all keys in this store. The keys may be ordered but not necessarily.

      • getLocalKeyPartition

        public ByteBuffer[] getLocalKeyPartition()
                                  throws StorageException
        Description copied from interface: KeyColumnValueStore
        Returns an array that describes the key boundaries of the locally hosted partition of this store.

        The array has two entries: the first marks the lower bound for the keys stored locally (inclusive) and the other marks the upper bound (exclusive).

        Specified by:
        getLocalKeyPartition in interface KeyColumnValueStore
        Returns:
        An array with two entries describing the locally hosted partition of this store.
        Throws:
        StorageException

        Description copied from interface: KeyColumnValueStore
